**Culture of ISCs and intestinal organoids**
_Expansion and routine culture of ISC colonies_
ISCs are expanded and cultured in ~1.3 kPa PEG-VS gels, i.e. gels formed by crosslinking \[PEG-VS]-NDG-Lys and \[PEG-VS]-Gln.
The polymer content needed to achieve the gel stiffness optimal for ISC expansion is determined by rheometry \(
See above), and is typically in the range 2.5-3.5% \(w/v).
1. Prepare a \[PEG-VS]-NDG-Lys/\[PEG-VS]-Gln gel

Mix at the appropriate polymer content, containing 1 mM RGD, as described above, using the spare volume to incorporate a suspension of dissociated ISCs at a final concentration 200-500 cells/μl. 
  2.
Cast 15-20 μl droplets of the
Mix onto the bottom of a 24-well plate, and allow for gelation to occur \(15 min, 37°C).
Note: to
Ensure homogenous cell distribution throughout the gel, flip the
Plate between the upright and upside-down positions every minute during the first 5 min of gelation.
Use caution not to dis
Place the liquid droplets from the center of the wells and onto the well walls during the flipping process.

3. Overlay the gels with 600 μl of complete ISC expansion medium: Advanced DMEM/F12 containing Glutamax, HEPES, penicillin-streptomycin, B27, N2 and 1 μM N-acetylcysteine, supplemented with growth factors, including EGF \(50 ng/ml), Noggin \(100 ng/ml) and R-spondin \(500 ng/ml), and small molecules, including CHIR99021 \(3 μM), valproic acid \(1 mM) and thiazovivin \(2.5 μM).
Growth factors and small molecules are replenished every two days, and the full medium is changed every four days.
